title: Introduction to atctools Package
text: Welcome atctools package vignette! vignette provides overview package functionality, demonstrates usage key functions, explains example datasets included.

title: Introduction to atctools Package
text: atctools package provides tools ATC (Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical) code matching data integrity checks drug names. includes functions matching drug names ATC codes without stripping trailing characters. atctools package comprises: drug_match: Matches drug names ATC codes without stripping trailing characters. drug_match_strip: Matches drug names ATC codes, stripping trailing characters “mg”, “g”, etc. atc2drug: Matches ATC codes drug names. example_drug_data: Drug names without milligrams. example_drug_data_with_mg: Drug names including milligrams. example_reference_data: Reference data ATC codes corresponding drug names. example_atc_data: ATC codes testing atc2drug function, including valid, non-valid, NA values.

title: Introduction to atctools Package
text: dataset contains example drug names without milligrams.
code: example_drug_data #>       drug_name #> 1       Aspirin #> 2   Paracetamol #> 3     Ibuprofen #> 4    Cetirizine #> 5    Lisinopril #> 6     Metformin #> 7  Atorvastatin #> 8    Omeprazole #> 9    Salbutamol #> 10  Amoxicillin

title: Introduction to atctools Package
text: dataset contains example drug names including milligrams.
code: example_drug_data_with_mg #>            drug_name #> 1      Aspirin 100mg #> 2  Paracetamol 500mg #> 3    Ibuprofen 200mg #> 4    Cetirizine 10mg #> 5    Lisinopril 20mg #> 6   Metformin 1000mg #> 7  Atorvastatin 40mg #> 8    Omeprazole 20mg #> 9     Salbutamol 2mg #> 10 Amoxicillin 500mg

title: Introduction to atctools Package
text: dataset reference dataset containing example drug names corresponding ATC codes drug matching. Please ensure : first column (example: drug_name) contains drug names. second column (example: ATC_code) contains ATC codes.
code: example_reference_data #>       drug_name ATC_code #> 1       Aspirin  B01AC06 #> 2   Paracetamol  N02BE01 #> 3     Ibuprofen  M01AE01 #> 4    Cetirizine  R06AE07 #> 5    Lisinopril  C09AA03 #> 6     Metformin  A10BA02 #> 7  Atorvastatin  C10AA05 #> 8    Omeprazole  A02BC01 #> 9    Salbutamol  R03AC02 #> 10  Amoxicillin  J01CA04

title: Introduction to atctools Package
text: dataset provides example ATC codes testing atc2drug function. includes valid ATC codes, non-valid codes, NA values demonstrate function handles different types input.
code: example_atc_data #>     ATC_code #> 1    B01AC06 #> 2    N02BE01 #> 3       <NA> #> 4    M01AE01 #> 5    R06AE07 #> 6 ABCDE12345 #> 7 abcde12345 #> 8       <NA>

title: Introduction to atctools Package
text: drug_match function matches drug names dataset corresponding ATC codes using reference dataset. strip trailing characters drug names. Usage:
code: library(atctools)  # Perform drug matching output_data1 <- drug_match(example_drug_data, "drug_name", example_reference_data) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union  # Display output data output_data1 #>       drug_name drug_name_original drug_name_matched drug_name_flag #> 1       Aspirin            aspirin           Aspirin              1 #> 2   Paracetamol        paracetamol       Paracetamol              1 #> 3     Ibuprofen          ibuprofen         Ibuprofen              1 #> 4    Cetirizine         cetirizine        Cetirizine              1 #> 5    Lisinopril         lisinopril        Lisinopril              1 #> 6     Metformin          metformin         Metformin              1 #> 7  Atorvastatin       atorvastatin      Atorvastatin              1 #> 8    Omeprazole         omeprazole        Omeprazole              1 #> 9    Salbutamol         salbutamol        Salbutamol              1 #> 10  Amoxicillin        amoxicillin       Amoxicillin              1 #>    drug_name_ATC #> 1        B01AC06 #> 2        N02BE01 #> 3        M01AE01 #> 4        R06AE07 #> 5        C09AA03 #> 6        A10BA02 #> 7        C10AA05 #> 8        A02BC01 #> 9        R03AC02 #> 10       J01CA04

title: Introduction to atctools Package
text: drug_match_strip function matches drug names dataset corresponding ATC codes, stripping trailing characters (e.g., “mg”, “g”) drug names matching. Usage:
code: # Perform drug matching with trailing characters stripped output_data2 <- drug_match_strip(example_drug_data_with_mg, "drug_name", example_reference_data)  # Display output data output_data2 #>            drug_name drug_name_stripped drug_name_matched drug_name_flag #> 1      Aspirin 100mg            aspirin           Aspirin              1 #> 2  Paracetamol 500mg        paracetamol       Paracetamol              1 #> 3    Ibuprofen 200mg          ibuprofen         Ibuprofen              1 #> 4    Cetirizine 10mg         cetirizine        Cetirizine              1 #> 5    Lisinopril 20mg         lisinopril        Lisinopril              1 #> 6   Metformin 1000mg          metformin         Metformin              1 #> 7  Atorvastatin 40mg       atorvastatin      Atorvastatin              1 #> 8    Omeprazole 20mg         omeprazole        Omeprazole              1 #> 9     Salbutamol 2mg         salbutamol        Salbutamol              1 #> 10 Amoxicillin 500mg        amoxicillin       Amoxicillin              1 #>    drug_name_ATC #> 1        B01AC06 #> 2        N02BE01 #> 3        M01AE01 #> 4        R06AE07 #> 5        C09AA03 #> 6        A10BA02 #> 7        C10AA05 #> 8        A02BC01 #> 9        R03AC02 #> 10       J01CA04

title: Introduction to atctools Package
text: atc2drug function matches ATC codes drug names based reference dataset. handles valid ATC codes, ignores invalid ATC codes, returns NA non-matching codes. Usage:
code: # Perform ATC code to drug name matching output_data3 <- atc2drug(example_atc_data, "ATC_code", example_reference_data)  # Display output data output_data3 #>     ATC_code ATC_code_drug #> 1    B01AC06       Aspirin #> 2    N02BE01   Paracetamol #> 3       <NA>          <NA> #> 4    M01AE01     Ibuprofen #> 5    R06AE07    Cetirizine #> 6 ABCDE12345          <NA> #> 7 abcde12345          <NA> #> 8       <NA>          <NA>

what: Flag Meaning in the Output Data of example_drug_data and example_drug_data_with_mg
title: Introduction to atctools Package
text: drug_name_flag column output dataset indicates whether prefix mismatch drug name matched ATC code. 1: Indicates mismatch first three characters drug name match first three characters ATC code. 0: Indicates match first three characters drug name match first three characters ATC code.

title: Introduction to atctools Package
text: vignette provides overview use atctools package drug name matching understanding flag column output. details function additional functionality, refer package documentation examples.

what: Tools for ATC Matching and ATC Data Integrity Checks
title: Tools for ATC Matching and ATC Data Integrity Checks
text: atctools R package designed facilitating Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical (ATC) matching ensuring integrity ATC data pharmaceutical datasets.

title: Tools for ATC Matching and ATC Data Integrity Checks
text: ATC Matching: Functions match drug names ATC codes using methods Levenshtein distance. ATC Code Matching: Functions match ATC codes drug names directly. ATC Data Integrity Checks: Tools verify consistency correctness ATC data.

previous_headings: Example Usage of ATC Matching Functions
title: Tools for ATC Matching and ATC Data Integrity Checks
text: drug_match function atctools useful matching drug names ATC codes without stripping trailing characters.
code: # Load the package library(atctools)  # Perform drug matching output_data <- drug_match(example_drug_data, "drug_name", reference_data)  # View the processed output output_data

previous_headings: Example Usage of ATC Matching Functions
title: Tools for ATC Matching and ATC Data Integrity Checks
text: drug_match_strip function atctools useful matching drug names ATC codes stripping specific trailing characters, “milligrams”. can particularly helpful dealing pharmaceutical data drug names may include dosage information needs normalized.
code: # Load the package library(atctools)  # Perform drug matching with trailing milligrams stripping output_data_stripped <- drug_match_strip(example_drug_data_with_mg, "drug_name", reference_data)  # View the processed output output_data_stripped

previous_headings: Example Usage of ATC Matching Functions
title: Tools for ATC Matching and ATC Data Integrity Checks
text: atc2drug function matches ATC codes drug names directly without using Levenshtein distance.
code: # Load the package library(atctools)  # Perform ATC code to drug name matching output_data_atc2drug <- atc2drug(example_atc_data, "ATC_code", reference_data)  # View the processed output output_data_atc2drug

title: Tools for ATC Matching and ATC Data Integrity Checks
text: output data frame produced drug_match drug_match_strip functions, drug_name_flag column indicates whether discrepancy stripped drug name used matching closest matching drug name reference data. Specifically: Purpose: drug_name_flag column flags instances first three characters stripped drug name match corresponding ATC code’s initial characters. helps identify potential mismatches inconsistencies drug naming conventions. Flag Values: 1: Indicates mismatch first three characters stripped drug name differ corresponding ATC code. 0: Indicates mismatch; first three characters stripped drug name match corresponding ATC code.

title: Tools for ATC Matching and ATC Data Integrity Checks
text: can install development version atctools GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("vljlangen/atctools")

title: Tools for ATC Matching and ATC Data Integrity Checks
text: Added atc2drug Function: function matches ATC codes drug names directly. Added example_atc_data Dataset: dataset includes ATC codes testing atc2drug function, valid non-valid entries along NA values. Updated Examples: Added example usage atc2drug function.

what: Match ATC Codes to Drug Names — atc2drug
title: Match ATC Codes to Drug Names — atc2drug
text: function matches ATC codes input data frame corresponding drug names using reference data frame.

title: Match ATC Codes to Drug Names — atc2drug
code: atc2drug(input_data, atc_column, reference_data)

title: Match ATC Codes to Drug Names — atc2drug
text: input_data data frame containing column ATC codes matched. atc_column name column input_data containing ATC codes. reference_data data frame two columns: - drug_name: character vector drug names. - ATC_code: character vector corresponding ATC codes.

title: Match ATC Codes to Drug Names — atc2drug
text: modified data frame additional column: atc_code_drug Drug name matched ATC code.

title: Match ATC Codes to Drug Names — atc2drug
code: # Example usage: data(example_atc_data) data(example_reference_data) atc2drug(example_atc_data, "ATC_code", example_reference_data) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union #>     ATC_code ATC_code_drug #> 1    B01AC06       Aspirin #> 2    N02BE01   Paracetamol #> 3       <NA>          <NA> #> 4    M01AE01     Ibuprofen #> 5    R06AE07    Cetirizine #> 6 ABCDE12345          <NA> #> 7 abcde12345          <NA> #> 8       <NA>          <NA>

title: Perform Drug Matching without Stripping Trailing Characters — drug_match
text: input_data data frame containing column drug names matched. drug_column name column input_data containing drug names. reference_data list two elements: - ATC_codes: character vector ATC codes. - drug_names: character vector corresponding drug names.

title: Perform Drug Matching without Stripping Trailing Characters — drug_match
text: modified data frame additional columns: drug_name_ATC ATC code matched drug name. drug_name_matched Closest matching drug name reference data. drug_name_flag Flag indicating mismatch (1) match (0) drug name ATC code prefix.

title: Perform Drug Matching without Stripping Trailing Characters — drug_match
code: # Example usage: data(example_drug_data) data(example_reference_data) drug_match(example_drug_data, "drug_name", example_reference_data) #>       drug_name drug_name_original drug_name_matched drug_name_flag #> 1       Aspirin            aspirin           Aspirin              1 #> 2   Paracetamol        paracetamol       Paracetamol              1 #> 3     Ibuprofen          ibuprofen         Ibuprofen              1 #> 4    Cetirizine         cetirizine        Cetirizine              1 #> 5    Lisinopril         lisinopril        Lisinopril              1 #> 6     Metformin          metformin         Metformin              1 #> 7  Atorvastatin       atorvastatin      Atorvastatin              1 #> 8    Omeprazole         omeprazole        Omeprazole              1 #> 9    Salbutamol         salbutamol        Salbutamol              1 #> 10  Amoxicillin        amoxicillin       Amoxicillin              1 #>    drug_name_ATC #> 1        B01AC06 #> 2        N02BE01 #> 3        M01AE01 #> 4        R06AE07 #> 5        C09AA03 #> 6        A10BA02 #> 7        C10AA05 #> 8        A02BC01 #> 9        R03AC02 #> 10       J01CA04
